reporting-org.narrative: Bundesministerium für wirtschaftliche Zusammenarbeit und Entwicklung (BMZ)
Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ)

description.narrative: The aim of the FC program "Shelter Reconstruction in Gaza" is to improve the living conditions and the return of internally displaced persons to structurally safe houses appropriate to their family situation, which were severely damaged or completely destroyed during the 2014 Gaza conflict. Subsequently, the scope was broadened to also include the rehabilitation of substandard homes. Furthermore, affected families whose housing had been destroyed in escalations of the conflict since 2014 have been integrated into the program and - in the context of a financial top-up in 2021 - a psycho-social support component was included. Œ ŒSince 2018, BMZ has provided a total amount of EUR 61.3 million for the FC program. Project executing agencies are UNOPS (United Nations Office for Project Services) with a focus on affected non-refugees and UNRWA (United Nations Relief and Works Agency) providing support to registered Palestine refugees. In the case of UNOPS, the target group also receives assistance in Housing, Land and Property (HLP) rights through the non-governmental organization Norwegian Refugee Council (NRC). Œ ŒReconstruction works are carried out by targeted families themselves ("self-help approach"), who are closely supported in this by the project executing agencies. Under Component 1 (UNOPS; EUR 5 million; completed), 155 housing units were reconstructed, and 519 families received legal counseling. Under Component 2 (UNRWA; EUR 18.15 million; completed), 682 housing units were rebuilt. Component 3 (UNOPS; EUR 25.15 million; under implementation) includes the reconstruction of approximately 420 housing units, legal counseling for approximately 700 families and the rehabilitation of approximately 1,375 housing units, as well as psychosocial support for approximately 85 affected families. Component 4 (UNRWA; EUR 13 million; under implementation) includes the reconstruction of approximately 380 housing units and psychosocial support for approximately 50 particularly vulnerable families of the target group.

Ziel des FZ-Programms "Wohnraum-Wiederaufbau in Gaza" ist die Verbesserung der Lebensbedingungen und die Rückkehr von Binnenflüchtlingen in baulich sichere und der Familiensituation angemessene Häuser, die während des Gaza-Konflikts im Sommer 2014 stark beschädigt oder komplett zerstört wurden. In der Durchführung des Vorhabens wurde das Projektziel um die Rehabilitierung von qualitativ stark unterdurchschnittlichen Wohneinheiten ergänzt. Des Weiteren wurden auch Familien, deren Wohnraum in Eskalationen des Konflikts seit 2014 zerstört wurde, in das Programm integriert und - im Kontext einer Aufstockung in 2021 - eine psycho-soziale Unterstützungskomponente mit aufgenommen. Œ ŒDas BMZ hat seit 2016 ein Gesamtvolumen von 61,3 Mio. EUR bereitgestellt. Projektträger sind UNOPS (United Nations Office for Project Services) für betroffene Nicht-Flüchtlinge und UNRWA (United Nations Relief and Works Agency) für registrierte Palästina-Flüchtlinge. Im Fall von UNOPS erhält die Zielgruppe auch Unterstützung im Bereich Land, Besitz- und Baurechten durch die Nicht-Regierungsorganisation Norwegian Refugee Council (NRC). Œ ŒDer Wiederaufbau von Wohnraum erfolgt in Eigenregie durch die begünstigten Familien ("self-help"), welche dabei eng von den Projektträgern unterstützt werden. Unter Komponente 1 (UNOPS; 5 Mio. EUR; abgeschlossen) wurden 155 Wohneinheiten wiederaufgebaut und 519 Familien erhielten Rechtsberatung. Unter Komponente 2 (UNRWA; 18,15 Mio. EUR; abgeschlossen) wurden 682 Wohneinheiten wiederaufgebaut. Die laufende Komponente 3 (UNOPS; 25,15 Mio. EUR) umfasst den Wiederaufbau von rd. 420 Wohneinheiten, Rechtberatung von ca. 700 Familien und die Rehabilitierung von ca. 1.375 Wohneinheiten sowie psychosoziale Unterstützung von rd. 85 betroffenen Familien. Die laufende Komponente 4 (UNRWA; 13 Mio. EUR) umfasst den Wiederaufbau von ca. 380 Wohneinheiten sowie psychosoziale Unterstützung für rd. 50 besonders vulnerable Familien der Zielgruppe.

The aim of the FC program "Shelter Reconstruction in Gaza" is to improve the living conditions and the return of internally displaced persons to structurally safe houses appropriate to their family situation, which were severely damaged or completely destroyed during the 2014 Gaza conflict. Subsequently, the scope was broadened to also include the rehabilitation of substandard homes. Furthermore, affected families whose housing had been destroyed in escalations of the conflict since 2014 have been integrated into the program and - in the context of a financial top-up in 2021 - a psycho-social support component was included. Œ ŒSince 2018, BMZ has provided a total amount of EUR 61.3 million for the FC program. Project executing agencies are UNOPS (United Nations Office for Project Services) with a focus on affected non-refugees and UNRWA (United Nations Relief and Works Agency) providing support to registered Palestine refugees. In the case of UNOPS, the target group also receives assistance in Housing, Land and Property (HLP) rights through the non-governmental organization Norwegian Refugee Council (NRC). Œ ŒReconstruction works are carried out by targeted families themselves ("self-help approach"), who are closely supported in this by the project executing agencies. Under Component 1 (UNOPS; EUR 5 million; completed), 155 housing units were reconstructed, and 519 families received legal counseling. Under Component 2 (UNRWA; EUR 18.15 million; completed), 682 housing units were rebuilt. Component 3 (UNOPS; EUR 25.15 million; under implementation) includes the reconstruction of approximately 420 housing units, legal counseling for approximately 700 families and the rehabilitation of approximately 1,375 housing units, as well as psychosocial support for approximately 85 affected families. Component 4 (UNRWA; EUR 13 million; under implementation) includes the reconstruction of approximately 380 housing units and psychosocial support for approximately 50 particularly vulnerable families of the target group.

Ziel des Vorhabens ist die Verbesserung der Lebensbedingungen und die Rückkehr von Palästinensischen Flüchtlingen und Binnenflüchtlingen in baulich sichere und der Familiensituation angemessene Häuser, die nach dem Gaza-Konflikt im Sommer 2014 stark beschädigt oder komplett zerstört wurden.

title.narrative: Für dieses Vorhaben liegt kein Eintrag zur Umwelt- und Sozialverträglichkeit vor.
